title: Ahmed Yahiaoui
text:
Ahmed Yahiaoui (born January 12, 1987) is a French <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Midfielder%20%28football%29">midfielder</a> of <a href="Algeria">Algeria</a>n origin.
Club career.
Whilst at <a href="Olympique%20de%20Marseille">Olympique de Marseille</a>, Yahiaoui was a target for <a href="Chelsea%20FC">Chelsea FC</a> but the club was unsuccessful in its attempts to signing him, as <a href="Olympique%20de%20Marseille">Olympique de Marseille</a> had persuaded him to stay with the squad. At the beginning of his career, Yahiaoui played for <a href="France%20national%20football%20team">France U-17</a>. However, he failed to make an impact at his then club <a href="Olympique%20de%20Marseille">Olympique de Marseille</a>, in contrast to his teammate <a href="Samir%20Nasri">Samir Nasri</a>. He left the squad to play one year for the <a href="Ligue%202">Ligue 2</a> side <a href="FC%20Istres">FC Istres</a>, before joining <a href="FC%20Sion">FC Sion</a>, from where he was released at the beginning of 2007.
Yahiaoui had been on trial at <a href="Everton%20FC">Everton FC</a> but failed to secure a permanent deal.
AS Cannes.
After having an unsuccessful week long trial with <a href="Everton%20FC">Everton FC</a> in an attempt to secure a permanent deal as <a href="David%20Moyes">David Moyes</a> was looking to strengthen his squad before the start of the 2007-08 Premier League season. Yahiaoui signed a contract for a year and a half with AS Cannes in December 2007 on a free transfer.
Honours.
International.
<a href="France%20national%20football%20team">France</a>
